intro: Cynanchum ansamalense, commonly known as the Ansamal milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate and often have a hairy texture, while its roots contain latex-like sap. This species is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, growing in rocky or sandy soils.
